title: Sr. Events Manager, Corporate Events
content:
Who we are 
About Stripe:
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team:
We build impactful experiences that drive awareness of Stripe, educate users and prospects on Stripe solutions, foster community, and deliver high quality leads to our sales team.
What you’ll do:
We are looking for an experienced senior event manager to join the Corporate Events and Experiences team to provide event strategy and operational support for Stripe’s flagship internal events and external user conferences. This role works closely with product marketing, design, communications, sales enablement, and other stakeholders/contributors. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker who excels in change management and can apply their understanding of the business to events in ways that deliver strong ROI and delight attendees. This is an opportunity to join a growing team and make a significant contribution to our largest events of the year.
Responsibilities:

Lead the planning, production, and execution of our flagship internal and external events
Plan and facilitate logistics for all events including contract negotiations, venue selection and preparation, presentation materials, security, catering, entertainment, av, transportation, equipment, decor and marketing materials
Facilitate attendee communications and guest experience touch points including event attendee logistics and registration
Develop and manage project plans, including documentation of strategy, process, objectives, deliverables, and timelines
Lead cross-functional workstreams; keeping them organized, facilitating collaboration and assisting with unblocking throughout projects
Own the day-to-day management of event operations and partnerships that support pipeline goals and event initiatives. Step in to fill holes where needed in an ever changing event landscape
Drive new ways of thinking about events and experiences and collaborate with the brand team to ensure brand consistency, engagement and results, globally
Think outside the box and push team members to bring innovative ideas and solutions to the greater team to keep our events dynamic and engaging

Who you are: 
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements:

10+ years of professional experience in event management of large scale user and internal conferences in real life and virtually 
Demonstrated leadership skills with strong ability to adapt to changing environments and prioritizing tasks
Proven experience in effective communications and relationship management
Strong background in content production and project management
Able to work collaboratively, creatively and cross-functionally in a dynamic work environment
Strong in developing processes and automating where possible; thinking at scale
Superior organizational, project management, written and verbal communication skills
Demonstrate attention to detail and proven track record to manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously
Experience with managing budgets, multiple vendor contracts and relationships
Data-driven mindset to focus on setting goals, measuring KPIs, communicating milestones along the way, and teaming with other stakeholders to showcase the outcomes of each event to stakeholders
Bachelor's Degree in Marketing or Communications strongly preferred

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
